oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dia!kwain (David Hoesar) (V)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The shade not to be sat in, unless it is really summer. In the Katkop dialect, by Dia!kwain (L V.-15. 5149 rev. and 5150 rev.). Dia!kwain's mother told him what happens if one sits in the shade when the weather is not very hot. 1) Dia!kwain heard this story from his mother (=kamme-an), 2) This story is found in Book V-15.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sitting in the shade
